main event: Three separate police units reported seeing a bright, round object moving across the sky near Bedford, VA. The object was described as being the size of a basketball and changing in intensity from extremely bright to a reddish hue. The object was observed for about 50 minutes as it moved from east to west at an undetermined speed.
interesting points: The object displayed an on-and-off light pattern, with periods of about 1.5 minutes of light followed by 3 seconds of darkness.
There were no known aircraft, balloons, or other controlled airborne objects in the area at the time of the sighting.
A check with the Washington Air Defense Sector and local air traffic control centers revealed no scheduled or known aircraft in the area.
The report mentions that a series of meteor showers were in progress at the time of the sighting.
The object was observed by multiple witnesses, including police officers and Air Force radar operators.
sighted object: a bright, round object changing in intensity
witnesses: three separate police units, Air Force radar operators
